alert.note: Alert for Glascock; Jefferson; Johnson; Washington (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 4:14PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Warren, Glascock, southeastern Washington, north central Johnson and central Jefferson Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 414 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Norwood to near Gibson to Davisboro to near Spann, and moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, up to penny sized hail, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Warrenton, Gibson, Davisboro, Stapleton, Bartow, Avera, Norwood, Camak, Edge Hill, Edgehill, Cadley, Grange, Stapletons Crossroads, Pringle, Reese, Mesena, New Home and Bastonville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
